processing.video

Class Capture

  • java.lang.Object
    • processing.core.PImage
      • processing.video.Capture
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, processing.core.PConstants

    public class Capture
extends processing.core.PImage
implements processing.core.PConstants
    Datatype for storing and manipulating video frames from an attached capture device such as a camera.

      • Capture

        public Capture(processing.core.PApplet parent,
               int width,
               int height,
               java.lang.String device,
               float fps)
        Open a specific capture device with a given resolution and framerate
        Parameters:
        parent - PApplet, typically "this"
        width - width in pixels
        height - height in pixels
        device - device name (null opens the default device)
        fps - frames per second (0 uses the default framerate)
        See Also:
        list()

    • Method Detail

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Disposes all the native resources associated to this capture device. NOTE: This is not official API and may/will be removed at any time.

      • frameRate

        public void frameRate(float ifps)
        Sets how often frames are read from the capture device. Setting the fps parameter to 4, for example, will cause 4 frames to be read per second.
        Parameters:
        ifps - speed of the capture device in frames per second

      • available

        public boolean available()
        Returns "true" when a new frame from the device is available to read.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts capturing frames from the selected device.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops capturing frames from an attached device.

      • read

        public void read()
        Reads the current frame of the device.

      • loadPixels

        public void loadPixels()
        Loads the pixel data for the image into its pixels[] array.
        Overrides:
        loadPixels in class processing.core.PImage

      • get

        public int get(int x,
               int y)
        Reads the color of any pixel or grabs a section of an image.
        Overrides:
        get in class processing.core.PImage

      • isCapturing

        public boolean isCapturing()
        Check if this device object is currently capturing.

      • fpsToFramerate

        public static java.lang.String fpsToFramerate(float fps)

      • setBufferSink

        public void setBufferSink(java.lang.Object sink)
        Sets the object to use as destination for the frames read from the stream. The color conversion mask is automatically set to the one required to copy the frames to OpenGL. NOTE: This is not official API and may/will be removed at any time.
        Parameters:
        Object - dest

      • hasBufferSink

        public boolean hasBufferSink()
        NOTE: This is not official API and may/will be removed at any time.

      • disposeBuffer

        public void disposeBuffer(java.lang.Object buf)
        NOTE: This is not official API and may/will be removed at any time.

      • post

        public void post()

      • list

        public static java.lang.String[] list()
        Returns a list of all capture devices, using the device's pretty display name. Multiple devices can have identical display names, appending ' #n' to devices with duplicate display names.
        Returns:
        array of device names
